history.content:
I'd suggest doing R&C or any humanities classes at CC first since it's easy to find an easy-A online professor via RateMyProfessors. Physics 7B depends on if you can find an easy prof since they're generally fewer sections offers for physics than humanities at a CC. Your CC grades won't affect your berkeley GPA but units would counts towards the 120 unit required to graduate.

----

Transfer Student answer

You should be able to take an English class and Physics class at CC together with no problem (you can always drop if worst comes to worse, but CCs have a earlier hard drop deadline before you are forced to get a W on your transcript (which doesn't matter anywhere unless you get a whole ton of them))

Definitely consult RateMyProfessor for a general feel of the class and professor, as I have had and heard about some who are not that great at their job (I've had a Physics professor who was lazy af)

Definitely consult RateMyProfessor for a general feel of the class and professor, as I have had and heard about some who are not that great at their job

Some are hard as heck (more than Berkeley sometimes), some are okay, some are easy.

Your CC grades won't affect your berkeley GPA but units would counts towards the 120 unit required to graduate.

I am currently considering applying for summer courses at community college because I have heard that they are easier and cheaper than the Berkeley summer courses. I am considering completing either my R&C B requirement (if they have a class) or Physics 7B.

Any suggestions on which I should pick, and how my grades + units would be transferred to Berkeley?
history.subject: Summer courses at CC
